analytic.title: Ein letzter Rest assyrischer Heimat: Berwarî Bala an der irakisch-türkischen Grenze

biblStruct.note: The Berwarî Bala region, located in the extreme north of Iraq right on the Turkish border, is the last remnant of the region of origin of the Mountain Assyrians. Originally, it belonged to the Kurdish Assyrian Emirate of Hakkâri. However, the Assyrian vill ages are now inhabited by only a few families, among them predominantly elderly people. Ever since the war between Turkey and the PKK spread to this region, many Assyrians emigrate also for this reason. My article focuses on this very last remnant of a historical region, and on those Assyrians who are still living there in 2023. I will do so by means of photographs taken in May and July 2023.
